title: no stack trace with kill -ABRT
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Write a trivial program that loops forever.  One is attached for your convenience.
2. Compile and run it. It will loop forever.
3. Send it a kill -ABRT

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

It used to cause the program to print a stack trace and die.  Now it just prints

quokka=% 6.out
SIGABRT: abort
pc: 0x1c13

and continues to loop. Only a terminate or kill -9 will stop it.


Please use labels and text to provide additional information.
